message.content:
cs.CE, cs.SE, cs.AR, cs.DC, cs.PL

Reasoning: 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper focuses on optimizing a scientific code (AIREBO potential from LAMMPS) and improving its performance on new architectures. This falls under the scope of computational science and engineering.
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses refactoring and hardware abstraction as solutions to improve the quality and maintainability of legacy code. This falls under the scope of software engineering.
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper discusses optimizing code for new architectures, such as KNL and Skylake. This falls under the scope of computer architecture.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses scalability and performance-portability, which are important aspects of distributed and parallel computing.
- cs.PL (Programming Languages): The paper discusses the journey from a Fortran code to a C++ port, as well as the use of vectorization and reduced precision. These are all related to programming languages and their features.
